channel.title: -Rep
channel.description: What if, and I mean if, we had the ability to take rep away? I see a lot of people(including myself) with more rep, for no apparent reason. I mean really, what have I done to help this community? Post bullshit pictures? Discuss.

item.title: -Rep
item.dc:creator: @_cake _cake
item.description:
@_cake wrote:

ThugLife:

Enforcing proper use just makes people think its worth the time.

we can't have the staff doing their job!

Read full topic

item.title: -Rep
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I really only read a few posts, on the first and last page here so maybe something similar has been mentioned.

On kaitnieks, I remember everytime someone would get rep–, they would always seem to bring it to the forums. They would go to whichever thread they were rep–'d at, and start moaning about “some fag just took away my rep for no reason!!” etc. Then the thread would turn into a flame war of some sorts. It’s not easy remembering, but I think this is one of the issues that got it removed. However, on kaitnieks it did not say who repped you(usually you’d leave your name in the comment) and that is probably one reason it was never contained in private messages.

Read full topic

item.title: -Rep
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:113, topic:156245”][quote author=ThugLife link=topic=213193.msg1872783#msg1872783 date=1194410032]
Wait, i’ll say this again, if “rep means nothing” like you all constantly repeat why are you all so bothered about how it gets given out and are always wanting to change it, indeed it does mean nothing so if you don’t care about it like you all keep repeating also then why not just ignore it?

I know what i just said is always being repeated by other people but just think about it.
[/quote]
People want changing in the Rep to make Rep means something.[/quote]

What the fuck are you chatting ?

People want to change the reputaton, hense forth making it mean something. - Is what I’m going to think you said. But anyway…

As Thug said, if rep isn’t an issue in the community, give the -rep a trial, maybe we will profit from this, instead of people constantly moaning.

Read full topic

item.title: -Rep
item.dc:creator: @god_of_ikiliki god of ikiliki
item.description:
@god_of_ikiliki wrote:

[quote=“ThugLife, post:59, topic:156245”]The only active Mod on Moparscape is God of ikiliki, but in my opinion there is plenty of gmods that can help out over there so there is really no need for more Moparscape mods.[/quote]Thats true.
Taharok wants to get de-modded and requested it a couple of times, he said he noticed how better life is without this forum.
With the gmods it’s better, just not if they’re not locking bad threads and just saying ‘haha’ in it.

Casey.:

How did moparscape mods get brought into this?

No idea =\

[quote=“exe626, post:56, topic:156245”][quote author=Silver Lining link=topic=213193.msg1864922#msg1864922 date=1194133195]
I vote myself for mscp mod, due to my amazing contributions there lately.
[/quote]Yellow dot lawl. Kiwi went right for it didn’t he.[/quote]
Lmfao, he posted stupid threads, I locked it and he reposted, I deleted and he reposted.
After that he decided to stop, but no, he came with another stupid thread, deleted it and got reposted again.
And even laughing about it on the IRC the same moment.
Warning wouldn’t stop him, he can still post it with a warning.

exe626:

I vote Casey for Moparscape mod.

No one on MSCP knows you lol.
They only know you from posting answers in simple questions like how to make a command.
You come with ‘add it into your client.java and your done’.
Doesn’t help?

Read full topic

item.title: -Rep
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Greeny:

I think it would be equally beneficial for the current rep system aswell though, even if we don’t introduce neg rep. If you want, contact me and I’ll draft something.

Agreed. Thanks for the offer, go ahead and write something up and post it or PM it to me.

Read full topic

item.title: -Rep
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:99, topic:156245”][quote author=Greeny link=topic=213193.msg1869928#msg1869928 date=1194299739]
If there were some set guidelines on how to use rep then rep might actually work. For instance as a rule:

-Give someone rep if their post has significantly helped you.

Now that’s very basic, and significantly means different things to different people, but at the moment the use of rep is somewhat ‘random’ so if some Rep Guidelines not rules were introduced then maybe that would help.
[/quote]

That is actually an excellent idea, if there were rock-solid guidelines to go by then the decision to reverse rep actions would be easy, and possibly negative reputation could even work. Hopefully we won’t need negative reputation though, it did nothing but cause problems on kaitnieks.com[/quote]

I think it would be equally beneficial for the current rep system aswell though, even if we don’t introduce neg rep. If you want, contact me and I’ll draft something.

Read full topic

item.title: -Rep
item.dc:creator: @planplan planplan
item.description:
@planplan wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:100, topic:156245”][quote author=vraj82192 link=topic=213193.msg1870015#msg1870015 date=1194303824]
You’ve done way more then just post some pics, the tuts really helped.
[/quote]

My reps:

therealjdb (+33/-43) exe626 (+24/-12) 2 ROFL - mitb In topic October 03, 2007, 09:57:38 PM

For saying this:

[quote author=exe626 link=topic=188075.msg1799426#msg1799426 date=1191488221]

trash bags are loud…
[/quote]You’ve never used a trash bad properly.

[Quote]
Mopman (+74/-58) exe626 (+24/-12) 4 Making me laugh is quite rare <3 - mitb In topic October 03, 2007, 08:21:54 PM[/quote]
For this:

[quote=“exe626, post:1, topic:148779”][right][size=7pt]I did not write this;
I didn’t even know this section was here till today.[/size][/right]

[center][size=12pt]Morning Poem
I [/size][size=7pt]woke early one morning,
the earth lay cool and still
when suddenly a tiny bird
perched on my window sill,
he sang a song so lovely
so carefree and so gay,
that slowly all my troubles
began to slip away.
[size=10pt]H[/size]e sang of far off places
of laughter and of fun,
it seemed his very trilling
brought up by the morning sun.
[size=10pt]I[/size] stirred beneath the covers
crept slowly out of bed,
then gently shut the window
and crushed his fucking head[/size]
[size=10pt]I’m not a morning person.[/size][/center][/quote]

[Quote]
Bobby (+17/-51) exe626 (+24/-12) 1 being very helpful - mitb In topic September 15, 2007, 11:52:51 PM[/quote]
For some PM about Runescape Mod center.

[Quote]
OnlyOneRule (+24/-10) exe626 (+24/-12) 1 im feeling generous - mitb In topic August 28, 2007, 01:42:21 PM[/Quote]
Because I repped him.

[Quote]
therealjdb (+33/-43) exe626 (+24/-12) 1 thank you man - mitb In topic August 25, 2007, 02:47:40 PM[/Quote]
For rendering 2 images.

[Quote]
XxKanexX (+68/-52) exe626 (+24/-12) 4 lel. - mitb In topic August 17, 2007, 08:22:17 AM[/Quote]
For fun shit.

[Quote]
OnlyOneRule (+24/-10) exe626 (+24/-12) 1 thought id give you some rep becuase youve been a bit kinder… - mitb In topic August 17, 2007, 08:09:30 AM[/Quote]
IDK why.

Casey. (+45/-54) exe626 (+24/-12) 1 Nice work - mitb In topic August 01, 2007, 08:20:26 AM[/quote]
For this:

[quote=“exe626, post:1, topic:129133”]Exe + Blank canvas and 12 beers = sexi sig?


Rate?[/quote]

I fail to see where I deserved the rep I have gained.

++
[center] Rule 4, --[/center]

Read full topic

item.title: -Rep
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:96, topic:156245”]If there were some set guidelines on how to use rep then rep might actually work. For instance as a rule:

-Give someone rep if their post has significantly helped you.

Now that’s very basic, and significantly means different things to different people, but at the moment the use of rep is somewhat ‘random’ so if some Rep Guidelines not rules were introduced then maybe that would help.[/quote]

That is actually an excellent idea, if there were rock-solid guidelines to go by then the decision to reverse rep actions would be easy, and possibly negative reputation could even work. Hopefully we won’t need negative reputation though, it did nothing but cause problems on kaitnieks.com

Read full topic

item.title: -Rep
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

vraj82192:

if you want to take away somones rep, you must have a certain ammount yourself.

Thats a given. We don’t need people making 50 accounts just to make sure someone has -500 rep.

Read full topic

item.title: -Rep
item.dc:creator: @vraj82192 vraj82192
item.description:
@vraj82192 wrote:

exe626:

What if, and I mean if, we had the ability to take rep away? I see a lot of people(including myself) with more rep, for no apparent reason. I mean really, what have I done to help this community? Post bullshit pictures? Discuss.

You’ve done way more then just post some pics, the tuts really helped.
I suggest that if you want to take away somones rep, you must have a certain ammount yourself.

Read full topic
